title: Byte literal does not propery handle with its character code.
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
fn main() {
    let _ = b'あ';    
}
```

I expected to see this happen: 
rustc says
```
error: non-ASCII character in byte literal
```

Instead, this happened: 
Got wierd errors:
```
<source>:2:14: error: unclosed 'byte char'
    2 |     let _ = b'あ';
      |              ^
<source>:2:16: error: unexpected character '82'
    2 |     let _ = b'あ';
      |                  
<source>:2:17: error: expected  0x0.07ffde973246p-1022fter character constant in character literal
    2 |     let _ = b'あ';
      |                 ^
<source>:2:17: error: unexpected character '27'
<source>:3:1: error: expecting ';' but '}' found
    3 | }
      | ^
<source>:2:5: error: failed to parse statement or expression in block expression
    2 |     let _ = b'あ';
      |     ^~~
<source>:3:1: error: unrecognised token '}' for start of item
    3 | }
      | ^
<source>:3:1: error: failed to parse item in crate
```

### Meta

- Using [godbolt.org](https://godbolt.org/)
